description: festival shirts, impulse hoodies, fast-fashion jeans. Worn a few times, then swapped, forgotten, or binned mid-trend.
trend pieces, seasonal layers, and untouched occasionwear. Discarded not because they broke — but because they no longer fit a mood or moment.
workwear, gym gear, night-out outfits — often replaced before worn out. Wardrobe churn normalized; few items repaired.
duplicates, misfits, and sale grabs — piling up faster than they’re worn. Styles change, habits don’t. Closets fill, landfills follow.
old uniforms, gift sweaters, fast-fading synthetics. Some never worn. Most still intact. A lifetime of garments, none truly gone.
